Package org.mitre.synthea.helpers

Class SimpleCSV

java.lang.Object
org.mitre.synthea.helpers.SimpleCSV
public class SimpleCSV
extends java.lang.Object
Helper class to translate CSV data back and forth between raw string data and a simple data structure.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SimpleCSV()

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public static java.util.List<java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> parse​(java.lang.String csvData) throws java.io.IOException
      Parse the data from the given CSV file into a List of Maps, where the key is the column name. Uses a LinkedHashMap specifically to ensure the order of columns is preserved in the resulting maps.
      Parameters:
      csvData - Raw CSV data
      Returns:
      parsed data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs while parsing the data

    • parseLineByLine

      public static java.util.Iterator<java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> parseLineByLine​(java.lang.String csvData) throws java.io.IOException
      Parse the data from the given CSV file into an Iterator of Maps, where the key is the column name. Uses a LinkedHashMap specifically to ensure the order of columns is preserved in the resulting maps. Uses an Iterator, as opposed to a list, in order to parse line by line and avoid memory overload.
      Parameters:
      csvData - Raw CSV data
      Returns:
      parsed data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs while parsing the data

    • unparse

      public static java.lang.String unparse​(java.util.List<? extends java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> data) throws java.io.IOException
      Convert the data in the given List of Maps to a String of CSV data. Each Map in the List represents one line of the resulting CSV. Uses the keySet from the first Map to populate the set of columns. This means that the first Map must contain all the columns desired in the final CSV. The order of the columns is specified by the order provided by the first Map's keySet, so using an ordered Map implementation (such as LinkedHashMap) is recommended.
      Parameters:
      data - List of Map data. CSV data read/modified from SimpleCSV.parse(...)
      Returns:
      data formatted as a String containing raw CSV data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - on file IO write errors.

    • isValid

      public static boolean isValid​(java.lang.String csvData)
      Simple CSV validator that ensures the number of columns in each file matches the number of elements in each row.

      csvData is split based on NEWLINE into a stream of strings.

      The stream is converted to a string of longs equaling the number of commas found for each csv line.

      Finally each distinct counts are taken from the stream. If the number of distinct counts is only one, we can confirm the CSV is valid.

      Parameters:
      csvData - Raw CSV data
      Returns:
      True if number of commas is consistent for each line Otherwise returns False
